item.title: Textile Recycling at Tompkins Square Greenmarket
item.description:
Date: May 22, 2011

Collections may be suspended for major holidays or extremely inclement weather. Please check our website or call 212-788-7964 for updated information.

item.title: Nature Walk: Birding Along the Hudson with Wave Hill and NYC Audubon
item.description:
Date: May 22, 2011

Explore the Hudson River’s avian ecology starting at the tip of Manhattan and migrating north. Walks are led by NYC Audubon naturalist Gabriel Willow, and alternate between Wave Hill on the second Sunday of each month and various off-site locations on the fourth Sunday of each month. Ideal for ages 10 and up. Light rain, snow or shine, so dress for the weather.

Registration recommended, online at www.wavehill.org, by calling (718) 549-3200 x305 or at the Perkins Visitor Center. Severe weather cancels. For weather-related updates, call (718) 549-3200, ext. 245 by 8:00 a.m. the day of the walk. Offsite location dates subject to change. Walks continue select Sundays: April 24 at The High Line, May 8 at Wave Hill and May 22 in Riverdale Park.

Start time: 9:30 am

End time: 11:30 am

Contact phone: (718) 549-3200

Location: Wave Hill

item.title: Summer on the Hudson: Downtown Boathouse Kayaking on the Hudson
item.description:
Date: May 22, 2011

Join the Downtown Boathouse for 20-minute instructional paddles, and explore the Hudson River first hand.

Please wear a bathing suit or shorts and a t-shirt, and know how to swim! This event is weather permitting. No registration required. Kayaks and life vests provided. Small lockers provided. Children under 16 must kayak with an adult. A 16 or 17 year old's parent or guardian must be present to sign a waiver and remain until the minor is off the water.

Start time: 10:00 am

End time: 5:00 pm

Contact phone: 311

Location: Kayaking on the Hudson Meeting Point (in Riverside Park)
item.event:location: Kayaking on the Hudson Meeting Point (in Riverside Park)

item.title: Green Currency: Plants in the Economy at The New York Botanical Garden
item.description:
Date: May 22, 2011

A multifaceted new exhibition of botanical art, Green Currency: Plants in the Economy opens at The New York Botanical Garden on Wednesday, April 20. Green Currency seeks to enrich visitors’ understanding of the important uses of plants through stunningly detailed and beautiful depictions by some of the world’s most accomplished botanical artists. The exhibition, accompanying catalog, and audio tour feature 43 works depicting plants used in medicine, food, clothing, and shelter. Green Currency is first medal-awarding international exhibition of botanical art in the United States and the Botanical Garden’s first juried botanical art show. Presented in conjunction with the American Society of Botanical Artists (ASBA), the exhibition is on view in the Arthur and Janet Ross Gallery, Wednesday, April 20 through Sunday, July 31, 2011.

For more details and to purchase tickets, visit the Botanical Garden's website.

Start time: 10:00 am

End time:

Contact phone: (718) 817-8700

Location: New York Botanical Garden (in Bronx Park)
item.event:location: New York Botanical Garden (in Bronx Park)

item.title: Hatha Yoga at Wave Hill
item.description:
Date: May 22, 2011

Release stress and find refuge from city life by practicing seasonal yoga, surrounded by the beauty of Wave Hill. Hatha Yoga involves the use of physical postures, breath control and meditation to create a supple, strong and relaxed body-mind. Classes are taught by instructors from Yoga for Bliss.

Participants should bring a mat, dress in loosely fitting clothing and come to class with breakfast well digested. Two levels offered, taught concurrently. The Beginners/Gentle level includes demonstrations of poses, clear instructions and some individual attention. The Advanced Beginners level focuses on alignment and flow, and is for students who practice more regularly and would like a more challenging class. Sessions are held outdoors only and are weather dependent. Call (718) 549-3200 x245 by 8:00 a.m. on the day of the class for weather updates.

Start time: 10:00 am

End time: 11:15 am

Contact phone: (718) 549-3200

Location: Wave Hill

item.title: Spanish Paradise: Gardens of the Alhambra
item.description:
Date: May 22, 2011

The lush gardens and poetic vistas of the Alhambra—the legendary Islamic palace and fortress in Granada, Spain—will be re-imagined in a large-scale, multipart exhibition at The New York Botanical Garden this summer. On view from May 21 through August 21, 2011, Spanish Paradise: Gardens of the Alhambra will provide a powerful evocation of the 13th-to-14th-century ensemble of landscape and buildings and the ways in which it has been viewed since its creation.

Start time: 10:00 am

End time:

Contact phone: (718) 817-8700

Location: New York Botanical Garden (in Bronx Park)
item.event:location: New York Botanical Garden (in Bronx Park)

item.title: Shred Fest
item.description:
Date: May 22, 2011

Shred your personal papers for free at a location near you! Free paper shredders donated by Staples for the first 4 people to arrive with their papers at each location.*

Join Department of Consumer Affairs (DCA), the Mayor's Office of the Criminal Justice Coordinator (CJC), Department of Parks & Recreation, and Department of Sanitation for the City's 4th Annual Shred Fest to shred old documents and get tips on preventing identity theft.

What should you shred?

  • Bank statements that are at least one year old and do not contain tax-related information
  • Pay stubs (only after you receive your Form W-2)
  • Credit card applications
  • Any other documents that contain your Social Security Number, account numbers, password/PIN information, your birth date, private contact information, and signature

*New York City government employees are NOT eligible to receive a free shredder. If more than three people are present at a Shred Fest site before DCA/CJC volunteers arrive, volunteers will use their best judgment to determine paper shredder recipients. Recipients will fill out a form to confirm they are not City government employees.

Special thanks to Brink's Document Destruction, Code Shred, ProShred Security, Shred Services Inc., and USA Shred for donating the mobile shredding trucks for the event, and to Staples for their generous donation of personal shredders.

Start time: 10:00 am

End time: 4:00 pm

Contact phone:

Location: Cadman Plaza Park,Vincent Daniels Square (in John Vincent Daniels Jr. Square),Playground For All Children (in Flushing Meadows Corona Park),Arthur Von Briesen Park (in Von Briesen Park),Ben Abrams Playground (in Bronx Park),Franz Sigel Park,Prospect Park Picnic House (in Prospect Park),Columbus Circle (in Central Park),135 Street Lawn (in St. Nicholas Park),South Plaza (in Union Square Park),Brennan Field (in Juniper Valley Playground),Roy Wilkins Park Parking Lot,Flatbush Nostrand Junction,MCU Park,Cropsey Ave. & Bay 29th Street (in Bensonhurst Park),Triangle Plaza

item.title: Bicycling Basics
item.description:
Date: May 22, 2011

Once balancing and pedaling are mastered, gain the necessary skills for efficient, comfortable riding. Bikes and helmets are provided at this useful group class – a must for new bicyclists. All ages welcome.

Pre-registration required at www.bikenewyork.org

Bicycling Basics is a free, 3-hour class for adults and mature teens who recently learned how to ride a bike or who want to improve their core cycling skills. From riding in a straight line to shifting gears for efficient pedaling, Bicycling Basics prepares riders for controlled, confident cycling.

Course Content

  • Bicycling Basics teaches the essential skills that are the foundation for smooth, confident cycling:
  • Adjusting your helmet for a comfortable, effective fit
  • Choosing the right size bike and adjusting seat height for a comfortable ride and a strong pedal stroke
  • Performing a simple bike inspection
  • Smooth, powerful starting
  • Controlled stopping
  • Riding in a straight line
  • Using shifters and gears efficiently
  • Using hand signals and scanning without swerving
  • Maneuvering around common road hazards

Start time: 10:00 am

End time: 1:00 pm

Contact phone: (212) 870-2080

Location: Van Cortlandt Park South at Putnam Avenue (in Van Cortlandt Park)
item.event:location: Van Cortlandt Park South at Putnam Avenue (in Van Cortlandt Park)
item.event:categories: Education | Nature | Fitness | Kids | Environmental Awareness | Sports | Bike Month NYC | Learn To Ride

item.title: Freshkills Park May Birding Tour
item.description:
Date: May 22, 2011

Join us on a special programmed tour as we search for the birds of Freshkills Park along the site's wetlands, creeks and meadows. This tour, like all of our bi-monthly birding tours, will be held jointly by naturalists from the Staten Island Museum and members of the Freshkills Park development team. It will diverge from the normal tour route and will be traveled by both bus and foot. This tour is a great way to witness the Freshkills Park site as well as the diverse wildlife returning to the region. This event is free, but space is limited, and registration is required.

To RSVP, please email doug.elliott@parks.nyc.gov or call (212) 788-8277.

Start time: 10:30 am

End time: 12:30 pm

Contact phone: (212) 788-8277

Location: Eltingville Transit Center (in Fresh Kills Park)
item.event:location: Eltingville Transit Center (in Fresh Kills Park)

item.description:
Date: May 22, 2011

A free multicultural, family-oriented festival, Drums Along the Hudson is the only open-air pow wow in Manhattan and includes exhibitions of world dance and drumming traditions. The festival combines a celebration of Native American heritage, culture, and art with the diversity of New York City itself.

item.title: Tree Giveaway Event: Joan and Alan Bernikow Jewish Community Center of Staten Island
item.description:
Date: May 22, 2011

Pick up a FREE TREE at a MillionTreesNYC Tree Giveaway this spring! Trees are available to all New York City residents and can be planted on private property, such as front and backyards, commercial properties, community gardens and faith-based institutions.

This tree giveaway program is an excellent way to begin or continue greening your neighborhood! Please keep in mind that any trees received through a giveaway event must be planted on private property and NOT on city streets or parks.

100 trees are available on a first come, first served basis, so make sure to show up early!

Start time: 12:00 pm

End time: 2:00 pm

Contact phone: (718) 475-5251

Location: Jewish Community Center of Staten Island
item.event:location: Jewish Community Center of Staten Island

item.title: Exhibition: New York's Civil War Soldiers: Photographs of Dr. R. B. Bontecou, Words of Walt Whitman
item.description:
Date: May 22, 2011

Presented in collaboration with The Burns Archive, in honor of the 150th anniversary of the start of the American Civil War.
Dr. R. B. Bonetcou’s photographs of wounded Civil War soldiers from New York regiments, on display for the first time since the 19th century, show the supreme sacrifices made by Americans and their families in sobering detail. Captioned by quotations from Specimen Days, Walt Whitman’s memoir of wartime volunteer nursing duty, these photographs, along with other images and memorabilia of the time, tell the real story that Whitman said would “never get into the books.” The exhibit also features a display about the 7th Regiment's gallant march to save Washington D.C. in April 1861 by John Lockwood and Charles Lockwood, authors of The Siege of Washington.

Start time: 12:00 pm

End time: 5:00 pm

Contact phone: (212) 777-1089

Location: Merchant's House Museum

  • have your child Learn to Ride or take Bike Driver's Ed with Bike New York, and;

Please note: All children must be present and accompanied by an adult.

End time: 4:00 pm

Contact phone: (212) 870-2076

Location: 34th Avenue and 78th Street (in Travers Park)

item.title: A Clearing in the Forest: Puppets
item.description:
Date: May 22, 2011

Enjoy the Central Park Conservancy's "Jack and the Beanstalk" puppet show by WonderSpark and plant your own magic beans to take home with you. All materials provided. Bring your imagination and a blanket to sit on. All ages welcome. Free. No advance registration. Weather permitting. For day-of weather-related cancelation, call (212) 860-1370.

This program is apart of the Central Park Conservancy's fifth annual A Clearing in the Forest series, which combines eco-education with multicultural family fun at programs in The Peter Jay Sharp Children's Glade every other Sunday from April 24 - October 9. Click here for more details and a full schedule of events.

Start time: 1:00 pm

End time: 2:00 pm

Contact phone: (212) 860-1370

item.description:
Date: May 22, 2011

People's Theatre Project and Seven Stories Institute in partnership with the YM&YWHA of Washington Heights and Inwood present Voices/Voces: Our Young People Speak, a theatrical collage of music, words and movement created and performed by local teens. Inspired by Howard Zinn’s Young People’s History of the United States and their own life experiences, the young actors have also created a printed anthology and an audio recording of their work which will be available at the performance.

item.title: A Road Once Traveled
item.description:
Date: May 22, 2011

Holding the northern highlands that would become Central Park was key in the American Revolution and the War of 1812 because armies could see their enemies approach as they sailed down the East River. History buffs will love this tour of the Harlem Meer and its strategic environs.

Start time: 2:00 pm

End time: 3:00 pm

Contact phone: (212) 860-1370

Location: Charles A. Dana Discovery Center (in Central Park)
item.event:location: Charles A. Dana Discovery Center (in Central Park)

Contact phone: (212) 408-0216

item.title: Tour the Newly-Opened Servants' Quarters at the Merchant's House Museum
item.description:
Date: May 22, 2011

Thanks to the Irish maids who slept and did some of their work there, the fourth floor servant bedroom now on view at the Merchant's House Museum is “arguably the oldest intact site of Irish habitation in Manhattan” according to Time Out New York. Every Saturday and Sunday, you're invited to come climb the narrow staircase and see where the wealthy Tredwell family's staff of four domestic servants lived and did some of their work. By opening this rarely seen space, the Museum can begin to tell the story of the courageous Irish women who fled poverty and starvation at home to find a better life for themselves and their family in mid-19th century New York.

Start time: 2:00 pm

End time: 4:00 pm

Contact phone: (212) 777-1089

Location: Merchant's House Museum

item.title: Handiwork
item.description:
Date: May 22, 2011

Imagine yourself in the past. Learn games, pastimes and tasks that were common 200 years ago. At Lefferts Historic House, you can try your hand at needlepoint, or write your New Year’s resolution with quill & ink.

Start time: 2:30 pm

End time: 3:30 pm

Contact phone:

Location: Lefferts Historic House (in Prospect Park)

item.title: Discover Tours
item.description:

item.title: Exhibition: New York's Civil War Soldiers: Photographs of Dr. R. B. Bontecou, Words of Walt Whitman
item.description:
Date: May 23, 2011

Presented in collaboration with The Burns Archive, in honor of the 150th anniversary of the start of the American Civil War.
Dr. R. B. Bonetcou’s photographs of wounded Civil War soldiers from New York regiments, on display for the first time since the 19th century, show the supreme sacrifices made by Americans and their families in sobering detail. Captioned by quotations from Specimen Days, Walt Whitman’s memoir of wartime volunteer nursing duty, these photographs, along with other images and memorabilia of the time, tell the real story that Whitman said would “never get into the books.” The exhibit also features a display about the 7th Regiment's gallant march to save Washington D.C. in April 1861 by John Lockwood and Charles Lockwood, authors of The Siege of Washington.

Start time: 12:00 pm

End time: 5:00 pm

Contact phone: (212) 777-1089

Location: Merchant's House Museum

item.description:

*Piano will be held from 2:00 p.m. to 4:00 p.m. on Thursdays, July 7, 14, 21, 28, and August 4, 11.

The program is free but pre-registration is required. To register, email Nancy at healthwriter2@aol.com. For more information, call Linda at (212) 795-1388 ext. 304.

Please note: We also offer Saturday Fitness Walking programs from 8:30 a.m. - 9:30 a.m. The meeting place is the same.

item.title: Green Currency: Plants in the Economy at The New York Botanical Garden
item.description:
Date: May 24, 2011

A multifaceted new exhibition of botanical art, Green Currency: Plants in the Economy opens at The New York Botanical Garden on Wednesday, April 20. Green Currency seeks to enrich visitors’ understanding of the important uses of plants through stunningly detailed and beautiful depictions by some of the world’s most accomplished botanical artists. The exhibition, accompanying catalog, and audio tour feature 43 works depicting plants used in medicine, food, clothing, and shelter. Green Currency is first medal-awarding international exhibition of botanical art in the United States and the Botanical Garden’s first juried botanical art show. Presented in conjunction with the American Society of Botanical Artists (ASBA), the exhibition is on view in the Arthur and Janet Ross Gallery, Wednesday, April 20 through Sunday, July 31, 2011.

For more details and to purchase tickets, visit the Botanical Garden's website.

Start time: 10:00 am

End time:

Contact phone: (718) 817-8700

Location: New York Botanical Garden (in Bronx Park)
item.event:location: New York Botanical Garden (in Bronx Park)

item.title: Spanish Paradise: Gardens of the Alhambra
item.description:
Date: May 24, 2011

The lush gardens and poetic vistas of the Alhambra—the legendary Islamic palace and fortress in Granada, Spain—will be re-imagined in a large-scale, multipart exhibition at The New York Botanical Garden this summer. On view from May 21 through August 21, 2011, Spanish Paradise: Gardens of the Alhambra will provide a powerful evocation of the 13th-to-14th-century ensemble of landscape and buildings and the ways in which it has been viewed since its creation.

Start time: 10:00 am

End time:

Contact phone: (718) 817-8700

Location: New York Botanical Garden (in Bronx Park)
item.event:location: New York Botanical Garden (in Bronx Park)

item.title: Bowl for North Brooklyn Parks
item.description:
Date: May 25, 2011

OSA invites you to our First Annual Bowl for the Parks!

Bowl with friends, family and colleagues as we raise money
for North Brooklyn Parks!

How to sign up to bowl and benefit North Brooklyn parks?

  • Choose the tier you’d like
  • Click the time slot you’re signing up for
  • When paying, list bowlers you want in your lane
  • Come May 25 and have a lot of fun!
  • All players must be over 21 years of age.

The Bowler $45 -2 hours of bowling and free shoe rental for one bowler!

BUY TICKETS FOR 6-8PM - BUY TICKETS FOR 8-10PM

The Dude $60 -2 hours of bowling and free shoe rental, two Brooklyn Brewery beers and an OSA shirt.

BUY TICKETS FOR 6-8PM - BUY TICKETS FOR 8-10PM

The Strike $350 - A lane to yourselves (up to 8 people) for 2 hours of bowling and shoe rental for everyone!

BUY TICKETS FOR 6-8PM - BUY TICKETS FOR 8-10PM

The Lebowski $500 - A lane to yourselves (up to 8 people) for 2 hours of bowling, free shoe rental, two Brooklyn Brewery Beers and an OSA T-shirt for each player!

BUY TICKETS FOR 6-8PM - BUY TICKETS FOR 8-10PM

Start time: 6:00 pm

End time: 10:00 pm

Contact phone:

Location: Brooklyn Bowl

Dr. R. B. Bonetcou’s photographs of wounded Civil War soldiers from New York regiments, on display for the first time since the 19th century, show the supreme sacrifices made by Americans and their families in sobering detail. Captioned by quotations from Specimen Days, Walt Whitman’s memoir of wartime volunteer nursing duty, these photographs, along with other images and memorabilia of the time, tell the real story that Whitman said would “never get into the books.” The exhibit also features a display about the 7th Regiment's gallant march to save Washington D.C. in April 1861 by John Lockwood and Charles Lockwood, authors of The Siege of Washington.

Start time: 12:00 pm

End time: 5:00 pm

Contact phone: (212) 777-1089

Location: Merchant's House Museum

item.title: Piano in Bryant Park
item.description:
Date: May 26, 2011

Tap your toes to the likes of Eubie, Duke, Mary Lou, Scott, Jelly Roll, and more - with world-class pianists performing a repertoire from ragtime and blues to contemporary jazz. Presented in partnership with Local 802 of the American Federation of Musicians and Sam Ash Music.

*Piano will be held from 2:00 p.m. to 4:00 p.m. on Thursdays, July 7, 14, 21, 28, and August 4, 11.

Start time: 12:30 pm

End time: 2:30 pm

Contact phone: (212) 768-4242

Location: Upper Terrace (in Bryant Park)
